title: Russia in 'far worse position now' than during 2022 talks | Michael Clarke analysis
description:
Russia is in a "far worse position now" compared to 2022, when direct negotiations with Ukraine last took place, security and defence analyst, Professor Michael Clarke, has been telling Sky News. 

Speaking with talks between Russia and Ukraine underway in Istanbul, Clarke said: "Compared to 2022, the Russians are in a far worse position now than they were then because in 2022, they thought, 'it's only a matter of time before we take the whole country'. "

title: Ukraine war: Putin no show at peace talks in Turkey
description:
The talks in Turkey were supposed to involve the presidents of Ukraine, Russia and possibly the USA. And they were supposed to usher in peace, or at least a ceasefire. Instead, Russia sent some low level officials while Vladimir Putin remained very much at home. 

(Subscribe: https://bit.ly/C4_News_Subscribe) 

Volodymyr Zelenskyy has travelled to Turkey but dismissed the Russian delegation as merely "decorative".  The Russian foreign ministry in turn called him a 'loser and a clown'.

title: Satellite images show Putin massing Russian troops on border with Finland
description:
Satellite images show Putin building up a substantial military presence on the Finnish border.

Images obtained by Swedish broadcaster SVT show four locations have seen a significant increase in activity.

NATO member Finland heavily protects its eastern border.

In 2022, a border fence was erected to provide more defence against a Russian invasion.

Following Finland‚Äôs accession to NATO, Kremlin officials threatened ‚Äòmilitary-technical response measures‚Äô.

This move shows a worrying war stance being adopted by Putin on Russia‚Äôs north-east border.

title: Russia urgently "cancels May 9" after massive Ukrainian drone attack
description:
#Kanal13‚Äã #likekanal13‚Äã #subscribekanal13 #warinukraine
https://www.youtube.com/user/kanal13az?sub_confirmation=1 - SUBSCRIBE TO US!
The aggressor country is urgently changing its plans regarding propaganda events timed to coincide with May 9. Following the massive attack by Ukrainian drones on Russian territory, a wave of cancellations of events planned for the said date has begun in the Russian Federation,  Verstka  writes . The restrictions affected at least Moscow, the Moscow region, the Vladimir, Lipetsk, Vologda regions and Mordovia. Thus, in Yegoryevsk, the memorial service for the victims was moved from the cemetery to the church "for safety reasons." In Ramenskoye, a school performance was cancelled, and in the Pavlovsky Posad District, evening concerts were cancelled, while car rallies and flower-laying ceremonies were retained. In the Vladimir region, the Immortal Regiment march and an evening concert have been cancelled in Kirzhach due to the "threat of a UAV crash". Similar measures have been taken in the Lipetsk region, where events have been postponed indefinitely and some events have been transferred to an online format. In Mordovia, the gala concert has been postponed to May 15 ‚Äì officially due to "Internet restrictions." In the Vologda Region, bad weather was cited as the reason for postponing the events. In addition, performances by Russian artists who were unable to fly out of the Russian capital due to flight delays are being cancelled. 

Recall, Russia‚Äôs Defense Ministry has claimed its air defenses destroyed about 524 Ukrainian drones in a single day during what it called the most massive drone attack to date. The figure came after pro-war Russian military bloggers reported a record drone and missile assault on Russia overnight into May 7. The Z-affiliated Telegram channel Voevoda Veshchaet stated that 447 long-range drones and missiles had struck Russia between the evening of May 6 and early hours of May 7. The bloggers described it as the largest drone attack since the start of Russia‚Äôs full-scale invasion of Ukraine. During the night, Russian Telegram channels tracked swarms of drones headed toward Moscow via Ryazan, Tula and Oryol oblasts. Residents in the Moscow suburbs of Yegoryevsk and Kolomna reported hearing the sound of UAVs and explosions.

By morning, Russian airlines had begun mass cancellations and flight mergers, citing disruptions caused by the drone attacks.

Andrii Kovalenko, head of Ukraine‚Äôs Center for Counteracting Disinformation at the National Security and Defense Council, said a number of high-value targets within Russia‚Äôs military-industrial complex had been hit.

In Saransk, a fiber-optic systems plant was struck. In Tula, the attack targeted the Instrument Design Bureau. Another target was the Splav enterprise, a key developer of multiple launch rocket systems for the Russian military.

title: North Korea confirms it sent troops to fight for Russia in Ukraine war | BBC News
description:
North Korea has for the first time confirmed that it sent troops to fight for Russia against Ukraine.
 
In a report on state news agency KCNA, Pyongyang's military claimed its soldiers helped Russian forces "completely liberate" the Kursk border region, according to an order given by leader Kim Jong Un.
 
Pyongyang's announcement comes just days after Russian Chief of Staff Valery Gerasimov praised the "heroism" of North Korean troops, the first time Moscow has publicly acknowledged their involvement.
 
Western officials had earlier told the BBC they believed at least 1,000 of the 11,000 troops sent from North Korea had been killed over three months.

title: Xi's Troops To Help Putin's Men In Ukraine War? China Military Says 'Ready To Strengthen...'
description:
China has said that it is ready to "expand practical cooperation" with the Russian army. The announcement comes days after Chinese president Xi Jinping visited Moscow to attend the Victory Day Parade presided by Russia president Vladimir Putin. Jinping's Moscow visit was condemned by Ukraine's allies, who accused Beijing of giving Moscow economic and political cover to wage a war of aggression.

title: Putin To Punish Ukraine If Istanbul Talks Fail? Big Russian Military Reshuffle Sparks Speculation
description:
Just before critical Russia-Ukraine peace talks in Istanbul, Putin shocks the world by firing his land forces chief, Oleg Salyukov. The talks, originally scheduled for May 15, have now been pushed to Friday. Ukraine‚Äôs President Zelensky, already in Turkey, voiced concern over the delay. As new delegations prepare, all eyes are on Istanbul. Can diplomacy prevail amid reshuffles and high-level signals?

description: Vladimir Putin was not included in a list released by the Kremlin of who will attend discussions between Russia and Ukraine in Turkey. description:

title: BREAKING: Russia-Ukraine end peace talks after 2 hours, agree to exchange 1,000 prisoners
description:
The first direct peace talks between Russia and Ukraine since the early weeks of Moscow‚Äôs 2022 invasion ended Friday after less than two hours, and a senior Ukrainian official said the Russian side introduced new ‚Äúunacceptable demands.‚Äù AP reports, before they adjourned, Kyiv and Moscow agreed to exchange 1,000 prisoners of war each, according to the heads of both delegations, in what would be their biggest such swap since the war began.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Zelensky Urges Trump To Meet With Putin Happen | WION
description:
In a significant development, Russian President Vladimir Putin has offered Ukraine the opportunity to restart peace talks without preconditions, proposing Turkey as the meeting venue. In response, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has expressed a desire for a ceasefire and welcomed Putin to Turkey for dialogues. Both leaders have not met face-to-face since 2019, raising questions about the feasibility of these peace talks.¬†

title: Russian drone attack on Ukraine bus kills nine, officials say | BBC News
description:
Local officials say nine people have been killed in a Russian drone attack on a civilian bus in north-eastern Ukraine.

The Sumy regional military administration said four other people were injured in the town of Bilopillia on Saturday morning as the bus travelled to the regional capital Sumy, close to Russia's border. 

The reported attack comes just hours after Russia and Ukraine held their first direct peace talks since 2022 - no breakthrough was achieved, although a swap of prisoners of war was agreed. 

Ukraine's national police described the bus attack as a "cynical war crime". Russia has not commented directly but said it had hit a "military staging area" in Sumy.

title: Peace talks between Ukraine and Russia take place in Turkey | BBC News
description:
Officials from Ukraine and Russia will meet today in Istanbul, Turkey for peace talks.
 
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is attending the negotiations, but criticised the "low-level" delegation being sent by Moscow as Russian President Vladimir Putin will not be there.
 
US President Donald Trump suggested that significant progress in peace talks was unlikely until he and Putin met in person.

title: Ukraine Is Using Robot Attack Dogs Against Russia | War on Tape | Daily Mail
description:
It looks like something out of science fiction but is in fact terrifyingly real - a robot dog being used by the Ukrainians to help fight the Russians. The Khartiia Brigade, which considers itself a model unit for the future Ukrainian army, has employed the dog on combat missions as a scout, using it to navigate minefields and map enemy trenches. 

But this is just the beginning - already, some people are experimenting with attaching weapons to it, and integrating AI would allow the dog to identify and attack its own targets. Which begs the question: Is this the future of war? Allow War on Tape to explain.

title: RUSSIA vs UKRAINE - 2 Years Later
description:
When Russia began its full-scale invasion of Ukraine back in 2022, the world stood by in terror as the initial fear was that the capital Kyiv, and then the country, might fall in a matter of days. This was due to a variety of factors including a much smaller military, economy, and less advanced equipment than what the Russian military initially possessed. But Ukraine proved the world wrong. So, with all that has happened since then, how do Ukraine and Russia compare with each other now 2 years into this bloody conflict? Watch right now and find out!
